title: Syllabus
text:
Course Title: Understanding Uncertainty: an Introduction to Statistics through Data Generating Processes and Computational Simulations
Course Schedule: 10 Weeks, 2 sessions per week, 1.5 hours per session









Week
Session
Topics Covered
Activities/Assignments




1
Session 1
- Course Introduction- Understanding Data Generating Processes (DGPs)- Introduction to Python and Jupyter Notebooks
- Install Python and Jupyter- Assignment: Write a simple Python program



Session 2
- Basic Python Syntax and Data Types- Variables, Expressions, and Statements- Generating Random Numbers
- In-class coding exercises- Assignment: Simulate a simple DGP


2
Session 3
- Data Structures in Python (Lists, Tuples, Dictionaries)- Importing and Exporting Data
- Load and explore datasets- Assignment: Data manipulation tasks



Session 4
- Descriptive Statistics- Measures of Central Tendency and Variability- Data Visualization with Matplotlib and Seaborn
- Plot histograms and boxplots- Assignment: Analyze summary statistics of a dataset


3
Session 5
- Probability Concepts- Discrete and Continuous Distributions- Simulating Random Events
- Simulate coin tosses and dice rolls- Assignment: Probability simulations



Session 6
- Exploring Different Distributions- Normal, Binomial, Poisson, Exponential Distributions- Applications of Each Distribution
- Visualize distributions- Assignment: Fit data to different distributions


4
Session 7
- Central Limit Theorem (CLT)- Law of Large Numbers- Practical Implications of CLT
- CLT demonstrations- Assignment: CLT simulation project



Session 8
- Understanding Uncertainty- Confidence Intervals- Margin of Error
- Calculate confidence intervals- Assignment: Confidence interval analysis


5
Session 9
- Introduction to Hypothesis Testing- Null and Alternative Hypotheses- p-values and Statistical Significance
- Hypothesis testing examples- Assignment: Formulate and test hypotheses



Session 10
- Resampling Methods- Bootstrapping Concepts- Estimating Uncertainty with Bootstrapping
- Bootstrap simulations- Assignment: Bootstrap confidence intervals


6
Session 11
- Permutation Tests- Comparing Groups without Parametric Assumptions- Practical Applications
- Conduct permutation tests- Assignment: Resampling project



Session 12
- Bias and Variance Trade-off- Introduction to Overfitting and Underfitting- Model Complexity and Generalization
- Visualize bias-variance trade-off- Assignment: Experiment with model complexity


7
Session 13
- Introduction to Machine Learning- Supervised vs. Unsupervised Learning- Training and Testing Sets
- Split data into training/testing sets- Assignment: Build simple predictive models



Session 14
- Evaluation Metrics- Accuracy, Precision, Recall, F1 Score- ROC Curves and AUC
- Evaluate model performance- Assignment: Model evaluation report


8
Session 15
- Regularization Techniques- Ridge and Lasso Regression- Preventing Overfitting
- Implement regularization- Assignment: Regularization project



Session 16
- Fairness in Machine Learning- Bias in Data and Algorithms- Measuring and Mitigating Bias
- Analyze datasets for bias- Assignment: Fairness assessment


9
Session 17
- Population Statistics and Representation- Sampling Methods and Sampling Bias- Impact on Statistical Inference and Fairness
- Simulate sampling strategies- Assignment: Design a fair sampling plan



Session 18
- Ethical Considerations in Data Science- Data Privacy and Anonymization- Regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA)
- Discuss privacy scenarios- Assignment: Propose ethical data practices


10
Session 19
- Responsible Data Science- Ethical Decision-Making Frameworks- Case Studies on Ethical Dilemmas
- Group discussions- Assignment: Reflective essay on ethics



Session 20
- Course Review and Future Directions- Student Project Presentations- Trends in Statistics and Data Science
- Present final projects- Course Feedback Survey
